application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
description: T.1 Yew - Reduce in height to 4.5-5m.T.2 Holly - Reduce in height by 3-4m to leave a finished height of 6m.T.3 Horse Chestnut - carry out a mid canopy lateral reduction back from the garden by up to 2m to bring the canopy back into line to leave a finished branch length of 3.5m.T.4 Holly - Reduce in height by 3m to leave a finished height of 7m.T.5 Cherry - Fell (exempt).T.6 Horse Chestnut - remove the epicormic growth from the stem to a height of 6m, carry out a 1.5m lateral reduction back from the drive to leave a finished branch length of 5m.T.7 Cedar - Remove 1X small branch at 5m in height from over the drive and remove major deadwood, split and broken branches from the tree.T.8 Yew - 1.5m Holistic crown reduction. Finished tree height 8m, with a finished radial spread to the north 2.2m, east 2.2m, south 2m and west 1.3m. Raise the canopy over the roadside portion of the canopy to the fence line at 2m in height stopping at the fence line to maintain privacy. A cherry picker will be used for this work.T.9 Yew - 1.5m Holistic crown reduction. Finished tree height 9m, with a finished radial spread to the north 4m, east 4m, south 3m and west 1.3m. Raise the canopy over the roadside portion of the canopy to the fence line at 2m in height stopping at the fence line to maintain privacy. A cherry picker will be used for this work.
